title: Updates bar still missing
body:
Not sure if this is intended, heard it returned for many people. I've tried relogging, wiping my cache, and different browsers, but the updates section is still MIA. 
http://i.imgur.com/BEAWGT1.png

replies.body: To confirm - is this still an issue for you?

I would have seen your post sooner... If I had an update bar =/ 

Yes, still a problem.

Glad to see it's being looked into a little. 

http://i.imgur.com/z0quyOf.png

Hi we just pushed a change that might help. Can you please do the following:

1. Log out 
2. Clear your browser's cache
3. Log back in

If the box is still missing, can you let us know which browser and operating system you are seeing this on? We might need to do further debugging.

Still MIA

Using Google Chrome version 36.0.1985.143 m, and my OS is Windows 7 64-bit professional.

http://i.imgur.com/Tt1OpVI.png

Should be working now. We believe it was related to the fact that you are using Adblock Plus and we were getting accidentally flagged.

Without your screenshot I am not sure how we could have tracked that down, so thanks!
Well, not good you guys were getting flagged :0 But glad the issue is resolved (which, it is, hurrah!)
I have this problem as well

Just got mine back when I could finally log in again.  For some reason I haven't been able to the past few days but it seems to be fixed.

As a thought, this probably doesn't have to do with anything on your side; it's probably just an issue with Boards not being able to continuously see you're logged in.  If it thinks you're not logged in, it probably says "guests don't need the 'my updates' bar".  That's just one of the things I'm thinking the problem stems from.
Mine's back now, but it just came back earlier today. Have patience, my dear!
I've been using the link from another thread, just seemed most people had theirs return, while mine hasn't.
I'm using google chrome, and having no problems as of this time.
Chrome is my main browser as well, not sure why mine's still missing. Hoping it's some simple fix I can perform on my end, but it's looking more and more like I can't fix it.
Only odd thing i can think of is that I'm still running windows xp due to general lazyness.
